[File: aptos-core/storage/aptosdb/src/schema/jellyfish_merkle_node/mod.rs] [Function: encode_seek_key()] [Shard ID bounds] Does encode_seek_key() validate that the u8 shard_id is within [0, NUM_STATE_SHARDS), or can out-of-bounds shard IDs corrupt seek operations across database shards? (High)

[File: aptos-core/storage/aptosdb/src/schema/jellyfish_merkle_node/mod.rs] [Function: encode_seek_key()] [Capacity calculation] Can encode_seek_key() pre-allocation of Vec with capacity size_of::<Version>() + size_of::<u8>() cause memory issues with millions of concurrent seeks? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/storage/aptosdb/src/schema/jellyfish_merkle_node/mod.rs] [Function: encode_seek_key()] [Seek ordering] Does encode_seek_key() using BigEndian for version guarantee correct lexicographic ordering in RocksDB seeks, or can version overflow cause misordered iteration? (High)

[File: aptos-core/storage/aptosdb/src/schema/jellyfish_merkle_node/mod.rs] [Function: encode_seek_key()] [Shard ambiguity] Can encode_seek_key() produce identical seek keys for different (version, shard_id) pairs due to byte boundary issues, causing incorrect node iteration? (Critical)

[File: aptos-core/storage/aptosdb/src/schema/jellyfish_merkle_node/mod.rs] [Macro: define_schema!] [Column family isolation] Does the JELLYFISH_MERKLE_NODE_CF_NAME column family provide proper isolation from other schemas, or can cross-schema key collisions corrupt both Merkle nodes and other data structures? (Critical)

[File: aptos-core/storage/aptosdb/src/schema/jellyfish_merkle_node/mod.rs] [Type: Node] [Generic parameter] Can the generic StateKey type in Node<StateKey> be substituted with a malicious Key implementation that bypasses serialization validation, injecting corrupted state keys? (Critical)

[File: aptos-core/storage/aptosdb/src/schema/jellyfish_merkle_node/mod.rs] [Type: NodeKey] [Hash collision] Can two NodeKeys with different (version, nibble_path) pairs produce identical encoded keys due to hash collisions, enabling state replacement attacks? (Critical)

[File: aptos-core/storage/aptosdb/src/schema/jellyfish_merkle_node/mod.rs] [Schema: JellyfishMerkleNodeSchema] [Atomic writes] Does the schema guarantee atomic batch writes for multiple nodes, or can partial writes during power failure corrupt the Merkle tree integrity? (Critical)

[File: aptos-core/storage/aptosdb/src/schema/jellyfish_merkle_node/mod.rs] [Schema: JellyfishMerkleNodeSchema] [Versioning] Can schema version changes cause backward compatibility issues where old encoded nodes cannot be decoded after upgrades, causing state access failures? (High)

[File: aptos-core/storage/aptosdb/src/schema/jellyfish_merkle_node/mod.rs] [KeyCodec + ValueCodec] [Round-trip consistency] Is encode_key() → decode_key() and encode_value() → decode_value() guaranteed to be bijective for all valid inputs, or can round-trip errors corrupt node storage? (Critical)

[File: aptos-core/storage/aptosdb/src/schema/jellyfish_merkle_node/mod.rs] [KeyCodec + ValueCodec] [Concurrent writes] Can concurrent encode_key()/encode_value() calls from multiple threads race on shared state, causing non-deterministic encoding and state root divergence? (Critical)

[File: aptos-core/storage/aptosdb/src/schema/jellyfish_merkle_node/mod.rs] [KeyCodec + ValueCodec] [Error propagation] Do encode/decode errors properly propagate through Result<> types, or can silent failures cause corrupted nodes to be written to or read from the database? (Critical)

[File: aptos-core/storage/aptosdb/src/schema/jellyfish_merkle_node/mod.rs] [KeyCodec + ValueCodec] [Memory safety] Do the codec implementations use any unsafe code blocks that could cause undefined behavior, memory corruption, or data races? (Critical)

[File: aptos-core/storage/aptosdb/src/schema/jellyfish_merkle_node/mod.rs] [KeyCodec + ValueCodec] [Database corruption recovery] Can the schema detect and recover from corrupted database entries, or will corrupted nodes cause validator crashes during state synchronization? (High)

[File: aptos-core/storage/aptosdb/src/schema/jellyfish_merkle_node/mod.rs] [KeyCodec] [Nibble path depth] Can encode_key() be exploited with a NodeKey having nibble_path depth exceeding 256 levels, causing stack overflow during recursive tree traversal? (High)

[File: aptos-core/storage/aptosdb/src/schema/jellyfish_merkle_node/mod.rs] [KeyCodec] [Root node injection] Can an attacker forge a NodeKey with empty nibble path and arbitrary version to inject fake root nodes, replacing the legitimate state root? (Critical)

[File: aptos-core/storage/aptosdb/src/schema/jellyfish_merkle_node/mod.rs] [KeyCodec] [Shard routing manipulation] Can nibble path encoding be manipulated to route nodes to incorrect shards (out of 16 shards), causing sharding inconsistencies and state query failures? (High)

[File: aptos-core/storage/aptosdb/src/schema/jellyfish_merkle_node/mod.rs] [KeyCodec] [Nibble order reversal] Does encode_key() preserve nibble path ordering correctly, or can reversed nibble encoding cause parent-child relationships to be inverted in the database? (Critical)

[File: aptos-core/storage/aptosdb/src/schema/jellyfish_merkle_node/mod.rs] [KeyCodec] [Path truncation] Can decode_key() incorrectly truncate long nibble paths during deserialization, causing child nodes to appear as siblings and breaking tree integrity? (Critical)

[File: aptos-core/storage/aptosdb/src/schema/jellyfish_merkle_node/mod.rs] [KeyCodec + SeekKeyCodec] [Version rollback] Can an attacker inject old-version nodes into the database to roll back state to a previous version, enabling double-spending attacks? (Critical)

[File: aptos-core/storage/aptosdb/src/schema/jellyfish_merkle_node/mod.rs] [KeyCodec + SeekKeyCodec] [Future version injection] Can decode_key() accept nodes with versions far in the future, causing state queries to skip over legitimate current state? (Critical)

[File: aptos-core/storage/aptosdb/src/schema/jellyfish_merkle_node/mod.rs] [SeekKeyCodec] [Version seek overflow] Can encode_seek_key() with version = u64::MAX cause RocksDB iterator to overflow and wrap around, seeking to version 0 instead? (High)

[File: aptos-core/storage/aptosdb/src/schema/jellyfish_merkle_node/mod.rs] [SeekKeyCodec] [Cross-version contamination] Can seek operations accidentally read nodes from different versions due to imprecise seek key encoding, mixing state from multiple versions? (Critical)

[File: aptos-core/storage/aptosdb/src/schema/jellyfish_merkle_node/mod.rs] [KeyCodec] [Version overflow wraparound] If version counter overflows from u64::MAX to 0, can this cause catastrophic key collision between oldest and newest nodes? (Critical)

[File: aptos-core/storage/aptosdb/src/schema/jellyfish_merkle_node/mod.rs] [ValueCodec] [Child count mismatch] Can encode_value() serialize an InternalNode where bitmap child count doesn't match actual children vector length, causing index-out-of-bounds errors? (Critical)
